ovdesc.p: The application holds the skeleton of the ISO message that will be processed in the system. It captures the details like, field position in the ISO message, field length, field properties and field name in ISO message. It also holds information on the logic to be formed to calculate the mapping record to be used for an instance, the conversion logic to be used for translating the data, etc

desc.p: Description for the table, free field.

Routine attached to this field will be called in the pre-processing routine to perform any additional processing on the ISO message before being processed by the pre-processing routine attached to OFS
This field hold routine name. Routine attached here should have one argument value passed. Customized hook routines can be attached here for pre-mapping validations.
This field holds the values for forming INTRF.MAPPING data record Id. A routine can be attached here or data values i.e. ISO‖ 0 3 70 (In different multi-values) can be stored here
Interface specific Header name. In reference to ISO to be used as names in the specification. Ex: Message Type Indicator. If no header is used. This field can be left as null
For future use
Header position. Represents Header field numbers. If no header is used. This field can be left as null
Length of the field. If no header is used. This field can be left as null
Field type in case of ISO ex: FIXED, VARIABLE, BITMAP. If no header is used. This field can be left as null
For future use
For future use
Interface specific field name. In reference to ISO to be used as names in the specification. Ex: Message Type Indicator
For future use
Field position. Represents ISO field numbers in case ISO Messages.
Length of the field (Max length in case of ISO)
Field type in case of ISO ex: FIXED,VARIABLE,BITMAP
For future use
For future use
This is a multivalve set. ATM.TRANSACTION field positions are mapped here. Customized hook routines can be attached here for updating the fields in ATM.TRANSACTION.
For future use
This field hold routine name. Routine attached here should have one argument value passed. Customized hook routines can be attached here for post-mapping validations.
Indicates which type of transaction for which the record is created. i.e. ISO_BASE24_PHOENIX
For future use for local references
Reserved fields for future use.
